title: netnet.studio
partners: The Clinic For Open Source Arts
The School of the Art Institute of Chicago
content: netnet.studio is a playful, open-source, real-time code editor paired with a human-authored "classical AI" Teaching Assistant. As an AI-TA, netnet supports students by explaining code fragments, encouraging best practices, and correcting common mistakes. As a beginner-focused editor, netnet assumes your aim is digital literacy—not necessarily becoming a professional developer or poetic coder (though it can lead there). Digital literacy isn’t about technical mastery; it’s about something far more important: agency.

netnet.studio has been successfully used by hundreds of students across universities including the University of Chicago, the University of Waterloo and others. By removing many of the technical hurdles beginners face, netnet.studio offers a smoother ramp into creative coding, saving instructors hours in the classroom and reducing student frustration. Its self-revealing interface design also enables educators to introduce complex topics, like version control with Git, earlier than traditional tools allow.
